CommandDefinition.Name: killprocess
CommandDefinition.Description: Tries to abort a given order (and all orders belonging to its family) and especially frees the capacities that it uses. Cancels the order if it is waiting to be scheduled and frees its allocated capacities. Tries to interrupt the executing thread(s) if the order is already running.

Argument.Name: orderId
Argument.Description: The ID of the order to be aborted

BoolOption.Name: i
BoolOption.Description: If set, an order waiting to be resumed in the scheduler will ignore its capacities and vetos. Only applicable if the order abortion will result in the execution of its workflows compensation.

BoolOption.Name: f
BoolOption.Description: If set, hanging coded services will be tried to stop via Thread.stop after not responding to Thread.interrupt/abort. Attention: Depending on the implementation of the coded servce being stopped, this may result in harmful side effects for the server infrastructure.
